content.text:
[@patrick](@JUBGIPQ3KzZEqc03FX53bZucL9i/UqgHQgpPyJHPzpw=.ed25519) 

I hear you and I can definitely relate. A few years ago I donated most of my belongings and tried to do the digital nomad thing in Europe, but it only took a few weeks until I was completely disenchanted by the lifestyle. I think I felt a strong urge to feel... deeply rooted? I'm not sure whether that's the best term for it, but I think I wanted to feel like I was grounded and supported by a resilient community rather than just city-hopping and making ephemeral friends in hostels.

Are there negatives that stick out to you the most, or things that you're looking to take advantage of if/when you find somewhere you'd like to stay for a while? For example, I was *really* looking forward to getting back into an exercise routine once I was a bit less nomadic, but that never really happened once I moved back to my home country...
